text:
Hey all – how does the GraphQL api work in terms of rate limiting? Know the rest API has something like a 500k a day limit. Does it work the same here per-request? or per-resolver?

Promise I’m not planning on doing either :sweat_smile:  just want to make sure we know and play nice!

Hey David - great question. Rate limiting works a little differently for GraphQL. We use a query complexity score to calculate limits, that exist on a per request basis, and a rolling minute basis. There is more details in <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/data/query-HubSpot-data-using-graphql#query-complexity-and-account-limits>. These limits are new, so we are interested in feedback on them!
What are you planning on building?

Awesome, thanks!

We’ve got a chrome extension where we’re augmenting the deals board, and fetching via GraphQL is a much better experience for the pieces we’re interested in
Awesome! Any screenshots or anything you can share? Would love to see what it looks like
